result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with any children/juveniles. 
No use of internet except to contact counsel.
Defendant can use the internet to communicate with customers for business purposes only including buying and selling used vehicles, registering vehicles that have been purchased from the business with the State, ordering parts for vehicles in need of repair/detailing, paying quarterly taxes and maintaining tax documentation.

9:38 AM Defendant German L Martinez in court.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for German L Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense filed a Motion to Modify Bond. State objects to bond modification. Court modifies bond conditions. Defendant to sign a new bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
